raw_text:
Based on the provided paper, I'll extract the structured information following the requested format:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Managerial Capital and Business Growth Study in Puebla, Mexico",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Subsidized Management Consulting Program",
    "country": "Mexico",
    "region": "Puebla State",
    "target_population": "Micro, small, and medium enterprises formally registered with the government"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": false,
      "cash_support_type": null,
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": null
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": false,
      "assets_provided": [],
      "direct_provision": "NO",
      "assets_evidence_citation": null
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "productivity",
      "return on assets",
      "sales",
      "profits",
      "employment",
      "business practices",
      "entrepreneurial spirit"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We measure impacts on the firms and the owners/managers in two different ways: (1) we administer a self-reported baseline and a one-year follow-up survey, and (2) we obtain confidential government data on employment levels and total wages",
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "Using data from the baseline survey, 150 enterprises were randomly selected to participate in the program. The randomization was stratified by sector (manufacturing, services, and commerce) and enterprise size (micro, small, and medium-sized)",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2007-2012",
    "sample_size": 432,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": true,
    "qualitative_methods": ["case narratives"],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": "We provide eight detailed narratives of the consulting advice provided to firms, and the perceptions by the owners and consultants of the impact of the advice on the businesses",
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "432 enterprises expressed interest in the program and signed a letter of interest",
    "country_citation": "We worked with the government of Puebla, an industrialized state close to Mexico City, to set up the experiment",
    "target_population_citation": "The program was open to enterprises that were formally registered with the government and were paying taxes"
  }
}
```

Note: This is not a graduation program - it's a business consulting intervention that does not include cash transfers or asset transfers. The intervention consists of subsidized consulting services provided to formal businesses. I've marked both Component A and B as false since there are no cash transfers or asset transfers involved in this program.
